titles.title: Providing for consideration of a concurrent resolution waiving the requirement in section 132 of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 that the Congress adjourn sine die not later than July 31 of each year.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-628, by Mr. Moakley.

Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to consider in the House a concurrent resolution waiving the requirement in section 132 of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 that the Congress adjourn sine die not later than July 31 of each year.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 193.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/28/1994--Introduced. Provides for consideration of a concurrent resolution waiving the requirement under provisions of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 that the Congress adjourn sine die not later than July 31 of each year.
